intro: Paquerina graminea var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf paquerina, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, pink or red flowers.
